intro: Hyperbaena cubensis var. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban hyperbaena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
